Description: Fragment of lower wall of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior, from the top: glazed with incised lotus and bud frieze with added red and white, above alternating red and white bands; reserved metope and triglyph frieze of dots and triple verticals; at the centre, the tip of a ray or bud. On the slipped exterior, frieze of rays, with four lines below. The exterior paint fired to weak red (10 R 4/4) and red (10 R 5/6).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare Alexandria 17256, not from the same bowl.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 25, no. 84 pl. 23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.159)
